paragraphs.name: 1ffe
paragraphs.text: I’ve actually been really excited by how Quora helps me figure out what to blog about. The questions are like prompts and the upvotes let you see what people actually care about, so you’re not just shooting into the dark.

450bddbca76a.title: Well my feeling of being poor is when I am in the supermarket buying cheap cat food I know the cats…

content.subtitle: And the fact that cats have brand awareness…

paragraphs.name: a678
paragraphs.text: Well my feeling of being poor is when I am in the supermarket buying cheap cat food I know the cats wont eat, but can’t afford the brand they prefer, when I realise that the woman in front of me has abandoned her trolley with the pound coin still in it. Such elation!
And the fact that cats have brand awareness…

paragraphs.name: 7c17
paragraphs.text: I wanted to like this. But I can’t. Chasing eyeballs isn’t the right way to write meaningful content —though I’m sure it’s a nice dopamine spike when it works. Publishers chase eyeballs to remain relevant, because news topics shift constantly. You can see the streams on Reddit and HackerNews as well. My point is, good writing should be written by…

content.subtitle: I started a blog a few months ago to give myself a venue to, just about, write whatever. I read a bunch to see how to build a blog people…

paragraphs.text: Hi Shaunta — thanks for this post. It resonated with me.

I started a blog a few months ago to give myself a venue to, just about, write whatever. I read a bunch to see how to build a blog people would find and read. However, most of the tips are essentially for folks who know their niche already and have a keyword strategy…

virtuals.subtitle: How to figure out what you want to say.

content.subtitle: How to figure out what you want to say.

paragraphs.name: d489
paragraphs.text: A strategy for blogging.

paragraphs.name: 54cf
paragraphs.text: How to figure out what you want to say.

paragraphs.name: 1c64
paragraphs.text: :) I’m glad it helped!

virtuals.subtitle: Thanks Shaunta Grimes. I really needed this strategy. Fantastic!

content.subtitle: Thanks Shaunta Grimes. I really needed this strategy. Fantastic!

paragraphs.name: 0c4c
paragraphs.text: Keep writing. Answer a Quora question a day, write on Medium at least once a week. You’ll narrow your focus as you see what you enjoy writing and what readers are responding to.

paragraphs.name: 2a89
paragraphs.text: Thanks Shaunta Grimes. I really needed this strategy. Fantastic!

virtuals.subtitle: I gave you a heart back ❤

content.subtitle: I gave you a heart back ❤

paragraphs.name: d5df
paragraphs.text: Thanks for the heart. I’m not sure why it’s wrong to figure out what people want to read before you write it. Seems reasonable to me. It seems entirely counterproductive to write publicly from my own passion without caring whether anyone wants to read it. If I want to do that, I write in a notebook and keep it in my bedside table.

paragraphs.text: I gave you a heart back ❤

paragraphs.name: b3ab
paragraphs.text: See now, this is a gorgeous little post. I am always suspicious of titles which declare that they have tips or strategies for finding writing topics. More often than not they tend to be the same few ideas being rehashed in post after post by different authors. No doubt they are drawing inspiration from existing classic sources and/or each other…

a78a0b99d12c.title: This article sent me down a rabbit hole to Quora, which I had never heard of before then down to…

paragraphs.name: af45
paragraphs.text: This article sent me down a rabbit hole to Quora, which I had never heard of before then down to your article about when you can call yourself a writer. I’ve written all my life, for myself, therefore never considered myself a formal “writer.” Then probably a year or two ago, after some successful writing projects at work, I thought screw it, I’m AM…
